From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

French

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • dev'nir

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old French devenir, from Latin dēvenīre, from dē + veniō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /də.v(ə).niʁ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Switzerland (Valais)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Toulouse)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Brétigny-sur-Orge)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

devenir m (plural devenirs)

  1. future
    Synonyms: futur, destin, avenir

Derived terms

[edit]
  • en devenir

Verb

[edit]

devenir

  1. to become
  2. (Louisiana, followed by de) to come from

Conjugation

[edit]

This is a verb in a group of -ir verbs. All verbs ending in -venir, such as convenir and revenir, are conjugated this way. Such verbs are the only verbs whose the past historic and subjunctive imperfect endings do not start in one of these thematic vowels (-a-, -i-, -u-).

pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Derived terms

[edit]
  • c'est en forgeant qu'on devient forgeron
  • devenir chèvre
  • petit poisson deviendra grand

Related terms

[edit]
  • venir

Further reading

[edit]
  • “devenir”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • deviner
  • venir de

Interlingua

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From French.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /de.veˈnir/

Verb

[edit]

devenir

  1. to become

Conjugation

[edit]

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

First known attestation circa 980 as devenguz (nominative masculine singular past participle form). From Latin devenīre.

Verb

[edit]

devenir

  1. to become, to turn into
    • c. 1250, Marie de France, Yonec:
      Chevaliers bels e genz devint.
      He turned into a handsome, noble knight.

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a third-group verb. This verb has a stressed present stem devien distinct from the unstressed stem deven, as well as other irregularities. Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of devenir (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive devenir avoir devenu
gerund en devenant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle devenant
past participle devenu
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present devieng, devien deviens devient devenons devenez devienent
imperfect devenoie, deveneie devenoies, deveneies devenoit, deveneit deveniiens, deveniens deveniiez, deveniez devenoient, deveneient
preterite devin devenis devint devenimes devenistes devindrent, devinrent
future devendrai devendras devendra devendrons devendroiz, devendreiz, devendrez devendront
conditional devendroie, devendreie devendroies, devendreies devendroit, devendreit devendriiens, devendriens devendriiez, devendriez devendroient, devendreient

Descendants

[edit]
  • French: devenir

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from French devenir.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /debeˈniɾ/ [d̪e.β̞eˈniɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: de‧ve‧nir

Verb

[edit]

devenir (first-person singular present devengo, first-person singular preterite devine, past participle devenido)

  1. to become
  2. to happen
    Synonyms: pasar, suceder, ocurrir

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of devenir (irregular; e-ie-i alternation) (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive devenir
gerund deviniendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular devenido devenida
plural devenidos devenidas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present devengo devienestú
devenísvos 		deviene devenimos devenís devienen
imperfect devenía devenías devenía deveníamos deveníais devenían
preterite devine deviniste devino devinimos devinisteis devinieron
future devendré devendrás devendrá devendremos devendréis devendrán
conditional devendría devendrías devendría devendríamos devendríais devendrían

vos 		él/ella/ello

devengásvos2 		devenga devengamos devengáis devengan

(ra) 		deviniera devinieras deviniera deviniéramos devinierais devinieran
imperfect
(se) 		deviniese devinieses deviniese deviniésemos devinieseis deviniesen

affirmative devéntú
devenívos 		devenga devengamos devenid devengan
negative no devengas no devenga no devengamos no devengáis no devengan

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Noun

[edit]

devenir m (plural devenires)

  1. coming, future

Further reading

[edit]
  • “devenir”, in Diccionario de la lengua española [Dictionary of the Spanish Language] (in Spanish), online version 23.8, Royal Spanish Academy [Spanish: Real Academia Española], 10 December 2024
